cards.back: A signal with finite total energy: E = ∫|x(t)|²dt < ∞
A signal with finite average power but infinite total energy.

cards.front: What is the power of x(t) = Acos(ωt)?
What is the power of a DC signal x(t) = A?
If energy is finite, what is average power?
cards.back: Zero. Finite energy / infinite time = 0 average power.

cards.front: Can a signal be both energy and power type?
cards.back: No, never. They are mutually exclusive classifications.

cards.front: Give an example of an energy signal.
cards.back:
• Single pulse
• Decaying exponential e^(-t)u(t)
• Any finite-duration signal

cards.front: Give an example of a power signal.
cards.back:
• Sinusoid Acos(ωt)
• DC constant
• Any periodic signal
